events.name: Dec Meetup - News Bytes, Managing Third party components and Weaponizing DOM XSS
events.description:
Null meets are free for anyone to attend. There are absolutely no fees. Just come with an open mind and willingness to share and learn Agenda:  Introduction & Networking : 15 mins News Bytes : 15 mins weaponising DOM based XSS  by Prasanna K Managing risk due to third party libraries in cloud by Suman Sourav  Abstract of the talk(s): 1. Weaponising DOM based XSS I am planning to cover some interesting DOM XSS , How I went about exploiting them and escalating privilege. I will cover some good methods Pentesters can do to find DOM XSS.  


2. Managing risk due to third party libraries in cloud In recent months we have seen several critical security threat because of third party libraries used in software products and services, Heartbleed, POODLE is a great example of it but things are not limited here since we have large threat landscape because of huge consumption of external third party components in cloud application development. Security threat will not stop ever since new attack vectors will keep coming in these open/external sources components but what is important here is how we handle risks due to these third party libraries.   Speaker(s) Bio: Prasanna K have been a Application Pentester for close to 10 years. Speaker @ nullcon-Delhi, Clubhack, IIT Guwahati and various null meetups. Enjoy solving new challenges. Creator of IronSAP a module over IronWASP. Present interest is in Fuzzing and UAF bugs discovery. 



Suman is having almost a decade experience in designing software security defense program and developed specialization in Product security engineering & cloud security engineering. He is a technical geek with security project management experience for banking & financial institutions, consulting firms, cloud service providers and product development organizations. He has closely worked with various organizations to develop security as culture & achieve software security certifications and targeted maturity model. 


Directions & Venue Map : KPMG clubhouse City House, 36 Robinson Rd, , Singapore[masked] See you all at the meetup!
events.location: KPMG clubhouse, City House, 36 Robinson Rd, , Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: vodQA - Passionate Talks
events.description: We are here again with fresh new edition on vodQA Singapore. vodQA is a platform for testing professionals and enthusiasts to share and learn new ideas and practices in the field of testing. On the evening of 16 Dec this year, before we all go on holidays and with change freeze already started, we thought it would be nice to catch up. The format this time however is not a workshop but we plan to host 3 distinct talks from our community members. We call the members of community for papers or presentations about a topic related to testing which they feel close to their heart and are passionate about. Besides RSVPing do register at link below for attending or to propose your talk: http://twsg.github.io/vodqa
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: WordPress Meetup (Dec 2015)
events.description: Ho ho ho! The last WordPress meetup of the year is here! In the December edition, we will see Jon sharing his experiences at WordCamp US 2015. The second talk to be confirmed. Jon Ang - WordPress Team member - Support & Theme Review What's next for WordPress & Experience sharing of WordCamp US 2015. Experience level: Beginner <second talk to be determined>  Jon will run a small Community Help Lounge whereby you can come ask him and other community members present, any questions about WordPress!! After the talks that is! Open space discussion We're looking for speakers and volunteers to help organise our meetups! Please contact Valentine, Jon or Robert if you're interested in helping out.
events.location: Amazon Web Services Office, Level 10, 23 Church Street, Singapore
